report.title: Inaugural of IEEE Microwave Theory and Techniques Society Student Chapter & Technical Lecture at Vardhaman College of Engineering, Shamshabad â€“ 501 218, Hyderabad

description.text: <p>IEEE MTT-S Student Chapter was inaugurated with motive to be efficacious in scientific,<br />technical and industrial activities in the field of EM, RF and Microwave engineering contributing<br />to the advancement of present and future wireless communications. The chief guest and guest of<br />honor attended to the event were present and past IEEE MTT-S chairs. Principal, HOD, Prof. P.<br />Nageshwar Rao, Head IQAC and IEEE Advisor Prof. M.A. Jabbar were the other eminent<br />professors who graced the event. Principal, HOD, IEEE advisor addressed the students and gave<br />the importance of joining IEEE and the benefits of joining as members in the organization. MTTS Student advisor motivated the students about the field of Microwaves, antennas and their<br />applications in present wireless field. Discussed about society&rsquo;s wide range of publications,<br />conferences, about importance of research and networking opportunities to the students. Later the<br />dignitaries released newsletter of the MTT-S student chapter &ldquo;TARANG&rdquo; and IEEE Approval<br />Letter for the formation of student chapter.&nbsp;</p> <p>A technical presentation on "Antennas, Probes &amp; Devices for EMI-EMC Applications" was given<br />by Mr. Sandeep Satav, Chair IEEE Jt Chapter AP/MTT/EMC, Hyderabad section &amp; Scientist, Head, EMI- EMC Centre, DRSS,<br />Research Centre Imarat, DRDO, Min. of Defence, Hyderabad. The technical talk gave more<br />practical insights in the field of EMI/EMC. A total of 170 members attended the session among<br />which 30 are faculty members and 50 are IEEE student members.</p>

report.cosponsor_name: Vardhaman College of Engineering, Shamsabad, Hyderabad

topic.title: Antennas, Probes & Devices for EMI-EMC Applications

report.title: 1 Day Seminar on Phased Array RADAR Modelling and Simulation

description.text: <p>The one-day seminar event covered Radar functionality, architecture, and performance modelling and analysis using NI-AWR Visual System<br />Simulator (VSS). Radar issues such as transmitter, antenna pattern, clutter, jamming, propagation, radar cross section, dynamic range, receiver<br />noise, receiver architecture, waveforms, processing, and target detection are treated in detail using VSS modelling and simulation capabilities.<br />Advanced topics such as Pulse Doppler, Monopulse Tracking and Phased Array Radar are presented and provided. This seminar was designed for<br />engineers and scientists who wish to understand and have practice on how to do Radar systems modelling, analysis and familiarize themselves<br />with the current technological frontiers.</p>

topic.title: Pulse-Doppler Radar System Modelling & Simulation & Monopulse Tracking Radar Modelling & Simulation
Introduction to Phased Array Radar & Demonstration & Complete Phased Array Solutions using Integrated Environment

report.title: Technical lecture on 'Electromagnetic Interference & Compatibility : An introduction' during inauguration of MTT Student Chapter at Matrusri Engineering College, Hyderabad

description.text: <p>Technical lecture on 'Electromagnetic Interference &amp; Compatibility : An introduction' during inauguration of MTT Student Chapter at Matrusri Engineering College, Hyderabad on 27 July 2019.</p>

topic.title: An Introduction to Electromagnetic Interference & Compatibility

report.title: Technical Lecture on "Reconfigurable Antennas: Theory, Challenges and Physical Implementation"

description.text: <p>Communication technology has been growing rapidly and current wireless communication systems have ability to achieve multifunctional capabilities with a single system supporting several applications with different operating conditions. However, as each application operates in different frequency band, with different radiation pattern or different polarization, such a single system requires multiple antennas. This is because historically from systems stand point, antenna has been viewed as a static device. Once an antenna design is finalized, its operational characteristics remain unchanged. This has driven innovation in antenna towards multifunction capabilities in competence with the contemporary communication systems. Reconfigurable antenna is a remarkable technology that adds novel features to existing conventional antennas whose characteristics are fixed and remain unchanged. The proposed talk will give an insight on the design and development of various reconfigurable antennas designed for wireless communication systems.</p>

topic.title: Technical Lecture on "Reconfigurable Antennas: Theory, Challenges and Physical Implementation"

report.title: 9th Sir JC Bose Memorial Lecture on 'Phased Arrays and Related RF Technologies for mm wave 5G Communication'.

description.text: <p>It is an annual flagship event of&nbsp;IEEE MTT/AP/EMC- Society&nbsp;Joint Chapter of&nbsp;IEEE Hyderabad Section. It was 9th annual lecture in the series. It is to mark birth anniversary of sir J C Bose, a great Indian scientist in the field of electromagnetics.&nbsp;</p>

report.keywords: Phase array, RF technologies, 5G communication, analog and digital beam scanning,

speaker.display_name: Prof. K J Vinoy, Fellow INAE

topic.title: Phased Arrays and Related RF Technologies for mm wave 5G Communication
